Sequence Information.Peptide Name: C-C motif chemokine 7 (Monocyte chemoattractant protein 3; Monocyte chemotactic protein 3; MCP-3;
Sequence Information.Family: Belongs to the intercrine beta (chemokine CC) family
Sequence Information.Target Organism: No MICs found in DRAMP database
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Structure Description: The shape of the MCP-3 monomer is that of an elongated tetrahedral. It consists of a three-stranded antiparallel Î² sheet and a three turn C-terminal Î± helix lying above the sheet floor. The N-terminal extremity is disordered up to residue 12, but located close to the helix; it consists of a long mobile loop, spatially stabilized because of the two disulfide bonds which link Cys 11 with Cys 36 and Cys 12 with Cys 52.
Sequence Information.Function: Chemotactic factor that attracts monocytes and eosinophils, but not neutrophilS. Augments monocyte anti-tumor activity. Also induces the release of gelatinase B. This protein can bind heparin. Binds to CCR1, CCR2 and CCR3.##PTM
